New Records: LeBron James recorded a 19/10/16 triple double in this outing.
Key Match Events: Anthony Davis went down with an injury after a swat from Jakob Poeltl, forcing him to leave the game.
Dalton Knecht made a three-pointer from LeBron James to make it 79-77, and the home team never looked back.
The Lakers went on a 19-8 run after Anthony Davis went down with an injury.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts had favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance.
The Raptors were already not projected to finish too high in the standings this season and were missing four key players.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Rajakovic praised the team's effort despite being exhausted and worn out.
The Raptors never let up or threw in the towel, but it was clear that the team was not quite as talented as the Lakers roster.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Austin Reaves led the game in scoring with 27 points.
RJ Barrett led the Raptors with 18 points.
All five Raptors starters plus Chris Boucher posted at least 12 points in a true team effort.
Others: The Raptors' road trip wraps up in Milwaukee on Tuesday night.
The Lakers' roster is fighting to keep their team alive in the playoff picture in the west.
